title: Will Varun Dhawan’s Baby John just be Vijay’s Theri on steroids, or is there more to it? - The Indian Express
summary:
Will Varun Dhawan’s Baby John Just Be Vijay’s Theri on Steroids, or Is There More to It?

Publication Date: December 2024, Source: Indian Express

Varun Dhawan’s upcoming film, Baby John, is an official remake of the 2016 Tamil blockbuster Theri, featuring Vijay. Directed by Atlee, Baby John marks Dhawan's first portrayal of a cop and raises expectations for a captivating narrative as it explores themes of familial bonds.

  • Key Connections: The film draws from the emotional core of Theri, emphasizing the father-daughter relationship and the protagonist's dual life as a father and a police officer.
  • Character Dynamics: The movie updates character relationships, including the love story between the cop and his wife, which has evolved since Theri.
  • Casting Choices: Rajpal Yadav's addition is noted as a change from the original, bringing a fresh dynamic to the supporting roles.
  • A Deeper Narrative: While promising more action and drama, the film aims to retain its emotional depth with themes of revenge and justice.
“Baby John, summa Therikka vidunga” (Baby John, let the sparks fly).

This film not only aims to resonate with fans of the original but also seeks to establish Varun Dhawan in a new light as he takes on the iconic role of a police officer. Expectations are set high as the film gears up for a big release this Christmas.
newTitle: Will Varun Dhawan’s Baby John Just Be Vijay’s Theri on Steroids, or Is There More to It?

title: Shyam Benegal Last Rites: Legendary Filmmaker Cremated With Full State Honours; Naseeruddin Shah, Gulzar Among Others Bid Tearful Adieu - Zee News
summary:
Shyam Benegal Last Rites: Legendary Filmmaker Cremated With Full State Honours

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Zee News

Mumbai: Veteran filmmaker Shyam Benegal, the pioneer of the parallel cinema movement in Indian cinema in the 1970s and 1980s, was cremated on Tuesday with full state honours and a three-gun salute here.

  • Benegal, known for films such as "Ankur", "Mandi", "Nishant", and "Junoon", died on Monday at a hospital due to chronic kidney disease.
  • The last rites were held at Dadar's Shivaji Park crematorium, attended by many film industry friends and family.
  • Notable attendees included Naseeruddin Shah, Gulzar, and other celebrated actors and directors.
  • Gulzar remarked on Benegal's revolutionary impact on Indian cinema, stating, "He brought a revolution that will never come again."
  • Actor Shreyas Talpade shared his unforgettable experience of working under Benegal's direction, highlighting his influence.
"He hasn't departed, we have departed from him and seen him off. He brought a revolution, he has gone with that revolution of change in cinema." - Gulzar

This gathering of tributes reflects the legacy of Shyam Benegal in Indian cinema.
newTitle: Memorable Farewell to Legendary Filmmaker Shyam Benegal

title: Mohanlal recalls his prediction about Fahadh Faasil after his debut movie fiasco: ‘It came true’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Mohanlal's Faith in Fahadh Faasil's Talent: A Success Story

Date & Source: December 24, 2024, The Indian Express

Introduction: Malayalam superstar Mohanlal shares his belief in Fahadh Faasil's talent, even when the actor faced initial criticism after his debut movie.

  1. Both Mohanlal and Fahadh Faasil were introduced to cinema by Fazil, Fahadh's father.
  2. While Mohanlal's debut was successful, Fahadh faced criticism for his performance in his first film, leading to a hiatus.
  3. Mohanlal expressed his confidence in Fahadh's talent before the latter's successful return.
  4. They have since collaborated in several films, including an upcoming project directed by Mahesh Narayanan.

“Once, Fazil Sir asked me, ‘How would you rate Fahadh as an actor?’ I told him, ‘Let Fahadh return and act in films.’ When he did return, my prediction came true. He is a great actor and is doing very well.” - Mohanlal

Conclusion: Mohanlal's faith in Fahadh Faasil's talent highlights the importance of persistence and belief in one's abilities, even in the face of initial setbacks.
newTitle: Mohanlal's Faith in Fahadh Faasil's Talent: A Success Story

Blake Lively Accuses Justin Baldoni of Sexual Harassment and Legal Drama Unfolds

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Blake Lively has filed a legal complaint against her co-star Justin Baldoni, alleging sexual harassment and an attempted smear campaign involving leaked text messages. This situation has drawn much attention regarding the origins of these texts.

  • Blake Lively's complaint includes accusations of assault by Baldoni, including coercing unwanted kissing scenes and observing her naked.
  • The legal documents suggest Lively obtained private communications through a civil subpoena, but it remains unclear how she accessed the messages.
  • Content involved conversations about how to undermine Lively's reputation within Baldoni's PR team.
  • Baldoni's lawyer claims the leaked texts were taken out of context and asserts that Lively's team knows the true facts.
  • The case points to a broader narrative around power dynamics in Hollywood and the treatment of women in the industry.
“If all of the text messages were produced in that ‘subpoena,’ then Lively’s team knows the true facts of what actually happened and did not happen.” - Bryan Freedman, Baldoni's lawyer

This legal battle highlights the complexities of power, privacy, and accountability within the entertainment industry. The outcome may have broader implications for how similar cases are viewed in the future.

title: Shyam Benegal: How Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi influenced the late filmmaker’s filmography - The Hindu
summary:
Shyam Benegal: How Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi influenced the late filmmaker’s filmography

Published: December 24, 2024 11:06 am IST | Source: The Hindu

The passing of Shyam Benegal, a titan of Indian parallel cinema, marks the end of an era. Known for his ability to weave his extraordinary oeuvre with a biting social realism, Benegal’s career was deeply intertwined with the political and cultural fabric of India. His encounters with Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and the Indian political scene seemed to have been influential in shaping his work.

  • Benegal's meeting with Nehru in the mid-1950s left a lasting impression on him.
  • His series Bharat Ek Khoj debuted based on Nehru's book The Discovery of India.
  • Interacting with Indira Gandhi, he experienced both admiration and criticism.
  • Gandhi intervened to lift the ban on Benegal's film Nishant, helping his career.
  • Benegal reflected on Gandhi's struggles with her father's absence and her early political image.
“He asked if he could join us at the lunch table,” Benegal recalled about Nehru. “His attractiveness was undeniable. That’s why I made Bharat Ek Khoj.”

Benegal passed away due to kidney-related ailments in Mumbai on December 23, 2024, at the age of 90.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal: How Nehru and Gandhi Influenced His Legacy

  • Sukumar expressed a desire to quit cinema jokingly during a recent event.
  • Allu Arjun is involved in a legal case after a stampede at his film's premiere led to the death of a woman.
  • The incident occurred when a crowd became uncontrollable as Allu Arjun greeted fans.
  • Protests occurred outside Allu Arjun's home demanding justice and property was vandalized.
"The crowd went out of control after Allu Arjun stepped out of his car to greet fans attending the premiere."

This situation highlights the ongoing challenges filmmakers and actors face and the serious consequences of public events.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Director Sukumar Considers Leaving Cinema Amid Allu Arjun's Stampede Controversy

title: Two noted Telugu movies set for re-release on New Year’s day - 123telugu
summary:
Two noted Telugu movies set for re-release on New Year’s day

Published on Dec 24, 2024

Source: 123Telugu

The re-release trend in Tollywood continues to gain momentum as two iconic films, Sye and Oy, are set to make a comeback on January 1, 2025.

  • Sye, directed by SS Rajamouli, is a sports drama featuring Nithiin and Genelia.
  • Oy is a romantic drama starring Siddharth and Shamili.
  • No major new releases for New Year’s Day could make these films popular among audiences.
  • The enduring appeal of both films suggests a strong box office turnout.
“These re-releases could draw significant attention, offering moviegoers a nostalgic and entertaining start to the year.”

Overall, the re-release of these beloved films signifies the ongoing trend in the Telugu film industry to revisit and celebrate classic cinema.
newTitle: Two Noted Telugu Movies Set for Re-Release on New Year’s Day
